newsitem.headline: NEW YORK, April 10 (Reuter) - The Federal gove.

text.p: The Federal government said 26 Pizza Hut restaurants in the New York area violated child labour laws by letting teens operate dangerous equipment like slicing machines, the New York Times said Thursday.
The Department of Labour fined the company, owned by PepsiCo, $194,400 in civil penalties, the paper said.
Federal law forbids people under 18 to operate dough mixers and rollers or electric slicers, the Times reported.
